name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about New Brunswick research and records

choices.name: Get started with research for your New Brunswick ancestors.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research resources. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about finding your ancestors in New Brunswick.

    ☆ FS Wiki:—New Brunswick—Finding Your Ancestors

  2. Explore resources for New Brunswick research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—New Brunswick Resources

  3. Learn about finding resources for New Brunswick ancestors.

    ☆ Finding Your Ancestors in Canada - New Brunswick
    ☆ AA—New Brunswick Genealogy

  4. Use the New Brunswick Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—New Brunswick Record Selection Table

  5. Explore county and parish resources on the New Brunswick GenWeb site.
  6. Explore a variety of records on the FreeCanadianAncestry site.
  7. Download free research guides for each New Brunswick county on the New Provincial Archives of New Brunswick site.
  8. Learn about resources for early New Brunswick research.

    ☆ The founding of New Brunswick

name: Vital and Census Records
section_name: Learn about New Brunswick vital and census records.

choices.name: Learn about New Brunswick vital and birth records.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for vital and birth records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.

content.text:
1. Learn about New Brunswick vital records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New Brunswick Vital Records

  2. Learn about and search New Brunswick provincial birth records.

    ☆ FS: New Brunswick Provincial Returns of Births

  3. Search for vital records on the New Brunswick Government Archives site.
  4. Learn about and search New Brunswick marriage records.

    ☆ New Brunswick Provincial Deaths

  5. Learn about adoption records on the OriginsCanada site.

1. Learn about and search New Brunswick death records.

    ☆ FS: New Brunswick Provincial Deaths

  2. Explore death record resources on the Death Indexes site.
  3. Explore New Brunswick obituaries on the In Memoriam site.

hidden.content:

content.text:

    ☆ FS—New Brunswick Census

  2. Learn about and search the 1861 New Brunswick census records.

    ☆ FS: New Brunswick 1861 Census Records

  3. Explore the MyFreeCensus site for New Brunswick state and county census records.

QUIKLinks

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for church and cemetery records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore New Brunswick cemetery records in this article.

    ☆ FS—New Brunswick Cemetery Records

  2. Browse the Interment.net site for New Brunswick cemetery records.
  3. Browse the I Dream of Genealogy site for New Brunswick cemetery records.
  4. Search for records from various New Brunswick cemeteries on the AcadianGenweb site.
  5. Search the Find A Grave site for cemetery records.
  6. Search the BillionGraves site for cemetery records.

name: Maps and Gazetteers
section_name: Learn about New Brunswick maps and gazetteers.

choices.name: Explore New Brunswick maps and gazetteers.

content.text:
1. Explore the David Rumsey collection of New Brunswick maps.
  2. Explore the Canadiana maps collection.
  3. Explore the Perry-Castaneda site for maps of New Brunswick (search for New Brunswick on the page).
  4. Explore historical New Brunswick maps on the Historic Map Works site. Select North America, Canada, and New Brunswick in the drop-down menus.
  5. Find New Brunswick towns and communities on the RoadsideThoughts site.
  6. Search for New Brunswick place names on the John Cardinal site.
1. Search vital statistics from New Brunswick newspapers in the Provincial Archives of New Brunswick site.

1. Find links to New Brunswick newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  2. Explore New Brunswick newspaper resources on the CanGenealogy site.
  3. Explore the New Brunswick newspaper directory.
  4. Search New Brunswick newspapers in the onlinenewspapers.com site.
  5. Search the New Brunswick Online Historical Newspapers site.
  6. Search New Brunswick newspapers in the world-newspapers.com site.
  7. Search New Brunswick newspapers in the ABYZ News Link site.
  8. Explore New Brunswick newspaper resources on the Ancestor Hunt site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for New Brunswick research.

content.text:
1. Explore links on the CanGenealogy site.
  2. Explore links in Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore links in GenealogyLinks.net.

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks to quickly search record collections for New Brunswick.

content.text:
• QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goal header area and in the page.
  • QUIKLinks point to collections with 50,000 or more records.

1. Explore the FamilySearch page for online genealogy records.
  2. Explore additional record collections in Ancestry.
  3. Explore additional record collections in Findmypast.
  4. Explore additional record collections in MyHeritage.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your New Brunswick research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the New Brunswick Genealogy page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Bathurst New Brunswick Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Find additional Facebook pages for New Brunswick genealogy on the Genealogy on Facebook site.

choices.name: Join a mailing list or message board for New Brunswick research.

content.text:
1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about New Brunswick research.
  2. Search the RootsWeb site for New Brunswick research mailing lists.
  3. Explore the New Brunswick research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.

choices.name: Learn about New Brunswick genealogy societies.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in New Brunswick in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New Brunswick Societies

  2. Explore New Brunswick genealogy society sites on Cyndi's list.
  3. Get help at a family history center in New Brunswick.
